instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  Dead boiard
threads.message: got in a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has liquid damage,  no power from charger or battery and no light on charge.  getting 2-8v on the <CAPACITOR>C9500</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9520</CAPACITOR>  2v.  found the <CHIP>U7091</CHIP> seems to be warm around 105 degrees vs 85 around the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  Dead boiard
threads.message: If you have no light on charger start with one wire and go from there

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  Dead boiard
threads.message: <CHIP>U7091</CHIP> does not exist. If <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets warm there is probably a short on PP3V42.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  Dead boiard
threads.message: I replaced every part that has pp3v42 going through it except for the big chips. and still nothing on the power adapter or board. im getting 275mv and 52mv on the l7095.  also im getting 300+ mv on the f7700 pin 2 and 6.6mv on pin 1 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.   i dont even know at this point

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  Dead boiard
threads.message: Maybe I've missed something but 52V where????
